ai.summary: A demanding long-distance trek on Mourne Way, a 69.2 km route through rugged uplands in the UK. Designed for experienced hikers, this multi-day journey combines steep climbs, exposed ridgelines, and variable weather. Plan for several days and ample time for navigation and rest breaks.
ai.terrain_summary: Rugged mountain terrain with rocky paths, peat bogs, exposed summits, and potential scree. Expect steep ascents and descents, uneven footing, and occasional water crossings. Weather can shift quickly; navigation and route-finding are important.
ai.safety_notes: Check weather forecasts and daylight hours before starting. Tell someone your planned route and expected return. Carry maps and a compass as your primary navigation tools; avoid relying on phone signal. Bring a waterproof shell, insulating layers, food and water, and an emergency shelter. Start early to maximize daylight, hike with a partner if possible, and turn back if conditions worsen.
recommended_gear: Base layer thermal top and bottom
Water for hydration (2–3 liters) and water treatment
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn are generally best for the Mourne Way, roughly May to September, with longer days and more stable weather. Summer offers the most daylight and clearer views; autumn provides pleasant colors. Winter hiking is possible for experienced hikers with proper gear and careful planning, but conditions can be severe and daylight is limited.

seo.title: Mourne Way: 69.2 km Hard-Distance Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Explore Mourne Way, a challenging 69.2 km long-distance trail in the UK. Learn about terrain, safety tips, gear, and best seasons for this demanding route.
seo.h1: Mourne Way — 69.2 km Hard-Distance Hike in the UK
